name: places/ChIJBWcjgIj2wokRYNnbETeZPvU
formattedAddress: 614W W 153rd St, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 614W W 153rd St, New York, NY 10031, USA

originalText.text: The system to request your car is ancient - you have to call in to request it but can never reach anyone by phone. When you finally get through and ask for it at a certain time, it's never ready when you get there. The different attendants tell you different stories re: how far in advance you need to call to request your car. There's no written policy. Finally, the bald guy with glasses is a petty tyrant. One time he was physically menacing. Another time he simply refused to get the car and we had to call the owner, who ended up sending a different employee. FWIW the other attendants are ok to somewhat nice. It's just this one guy who is a major problem. You don't have many choices in Hamilton Heights so you may not be able to avoid this place but be aware that there are major issues with this place.

originalText.text: If you care about your car avoid this parking lot by any means necessary

text.text: If you care about your car avoid this parking lot by any means necessary

originalText.text:
♿ Wheelchair accessible:
The entrance is comprised of two reasonably sloped driveways

originalText.text: The garage attendant on the overnight Sunday, November 21st at 3 AM is extremely rude. He refused to take my car in after I asked him to stop screaming at me to pull up the car and not indicating where he wanted me to pull the car up to. It is not the first time I’ve encountered the same attendant and management May want to look into this employee.  I’ve lived in this neighborhood for 45 years and I’ve often parked at this garage and I’ve never had this kind of encounter.

text.text: The garage attendant on the overnight Sunday, November 21st at 3 AM is extremely rude. He refused to take my car in after I asked him to stop screaming at me to pull up the car and not indicating where he wanted me to pull the car up to. It is not the first time I’ve encountered the same attendant and management May want to look into this employee.  I’ve lived in this neighborhood for 45 years and I’ve often parked at this garage and I’ve never had this kind of encounter.

originalText.text:
The other comment in here talks about a month parking pass.  I would never have need of one.  I only ever pay for my car to be housed for an evening and the rate cannot be beaten.  $20.  And less, of course, if you need a place to put your vehicle for a few hours.

I live in upstate New York and I have friends in Harlem that I visit.  This is the parking garage that I always use (at least half a dozen times) and I have never had any trouble with them.

I would recommend it solely if you needed a place to keep your car for an evening.  The other review mentions long term parking and I cannot say anything about that.
